page.title: 15Food
page.content: There are no shops in Garvald, the closest being 5 miles away, therefore the villagers depend to a large degree on the twice weekly butchers van and co-op travelling service. We tend to grow our own fruit and vegetables and few people favour tinned foods. There is a hotel in the village which caters for breakfast, lunch & evening dinner.Most of the residents shop on a regular basis, though the larger families prefer a monthly shop at one of the many 'super stores' in Edinburgh, where prices are far more competitive than Haddington. Most of the older ladies still have a regular baking session, though this is not so usual among the younger generation. However, nearly all of us are busy during the summer months making jams and chutneys. .
